p:
The strength of the catalyst developed was tested through catalyst recyclability and reusability test. The CWWA was recycled at the end reaction, because of the impurity at the surface of the regenerated catalyst; the washing with alcohol to remove impurity was carried out before being centrifuged at 4000 rpm for 25 min, and then filtered to obtain wet CWWA. The wet CWWA was then oven-dried at 150 °C for 120 min, allowed to cool at room temperature before reusing. The degeneration in catalyst strength was established by graphical plot, with a reduction in 5th and 6th cycles. Henceforward, the catalyst reusability test was stopped at the 4th cycle (Fig. 5).Fig. 5
Reusability test plot.Fig 5
